figure_1.title: Figure 1.
figure_1.caption: The online and offline phases of the scheme.

figure_4.title: Figure 4.
figure_4.caption: The effectiveness of the proposed scheme.

figure_5.title: Figure 5.
figure_5.caption: Comparison between ED3S, D3S, and SeqNum.

figure_6.title: Figure 6.
figure_6.caption: ED3S, D3S, and SeqNum Details Comparison.

claims.sentence: Figure 1 shows the proposed scheme.

Details of the Scheme
The proposed approach includes two essential parts, offline training, and online operation, as seen in Figure 1.
The flowchart of the detection process is illustrated in Figure 2.
The conceptual organization of the dataset collection scenario is shown in Figure 3.
Figure 4 shows the average results obtained by applying the proposed scheme during the operational mode.

Open in a new tab
The effectiveness of the proposed scheme.As shown in Figure 4, the scheme achieved 93.83% detection accuracy.
Figure 5 compares the performance of the comparable SeqNum Based scheme to that of the proposed scheme.

Open in a new tab
Comparison between ED3S, D3S, and SeqNum.Table 1 and Figure 5 show that the proposed scheme ED3S achieved the highest accuracy, 93.14%, compared to 88.10% for the D3S and 55.09% for SeqNum.
Figure 6 displays the proposed scheme’s strength against different de-authentication and dis-association attacks.
In Figure 6, the X-axis represents the test number.

Open in a new tab
ED3S, D3S, and SeqNum Details Comparison.As shown in thr Figure 6 accuracy section and Table 1, in most tests, ED3S maintained a stable accuracy above 93% for most attack types, compared to D3S whose accuracy dropped below 88%.
Figure 6 shows that the sequence number’s FPR is more stable than the proposed schemes ED3S and D3S.
However, the FNR in Figure 6 false-negative rate part of ED3S and D3S is more stable and much lower than that of the SeqNum scheme.
The F-measure part in Figure 6 shows that the overall performance of both ED3S and D3S is stable and around 90%, while it varies below 40% for the SeqNum scheme.
Figure 1 shows the proposed scheme.

However, the FNR in Figure 6 false-negative rate part of ED3S and D3S is more stable and much lower than that of the SeqNum scheme.
